Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Sayingsorry
Reviews.Content: I don't understand some of the bad reviews. I think the room I stayed in was excellent, The room smelled nice, the bathroom was very clean and so was everything else in the room. The free breakfast is limited but delicious and always fully stocked, you have a free meal every day while here! The front desk staff really helped me out on sightseeing tours, local places in the area, and of course the Price is Right across the street. The area around the hotel at night is a little sketchy but otheriwse this was really a great stay for the price and location! Can't wait to go back and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Poor desk service”
Reviews.Author: YiKEs09
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival traffic to turn in/out of the drive way is HORRIBLE. Parking spaces are limited. Once we got to the hotel, the desk service guy was rude. He did not attend to us for quite a wait. I believe my husband& i waited for about 5min until he looked up at us. All he was doing was texting. We checked into 2 non smoking rooms for the a night. We requested a room for disability because we had my parents with us. They're room was nice& spacious. Easy for elders to get in/out of tub. it was up stairs but no biggie. There was no problem at all with their room. When we checked in the room, it was nice, spacious, and it seemed to be clean. my room seemed to look tidy as well but once i lied on the bed, i notice a long strand of blonde hair. I do not have blonde hair i have red/black hair. I freaked and good thing the maid was right out my door. She was gladly to change the bed sheets, blankets, and pillows. Nothing else seemed to be wrong. However, do bring slippers. The carpet there is disgusting. Its so black and it smelled a bit. It is in a ghetto neigborhood and do be aware it is across the street from a hs. teenagers loiter all over the place. Dont let your guard down to be robbed or smoke blown into your faces. The door bolts are weak. the side of the doors looked like it be pried opened. But with our stay nothing happened. The pool outside was disgusting. the water was green. birds all over it. nasty. Its funny though, maids are consistency around the premises. hanging around in the laundry room. just saying. But they were nice to allow a customer to use the hose to wash his car. The promised breakfast. DO NOT RELY. the office was not even open until 11am (good thing they didnt charge for late check out. it was their fault for not being open). Oh and my mother left her traveling bag at the hotel. most hotels would call and let us know if we left something. Unfortunately, they dont care much for their customers. My mother didnt notice her bag was missing until the next day. i called in as ask for it they gave me a hard time and when i went to pick it up the same receptionist made me waited until he was done texting. in general you get for what the paid for. honestly would not recommend this place to anyone unless its only for 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, comfortable rooms, great front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: SoaringDiva
Reviews.Content: We arrived at mid day and got the last Kingsize bed on the second floor which was very comfortable. Very good budget hotel. Two most amazing things.... location, location, location Sunset Blvd W just W of Highland Ave. Within 2 minutes you are on Hollywood Blvd. The second was the front office staff. He gave us a tour map and since we had a car we did the tour bus route that took us through Bel Air, Beverly Hills, Brentwood, Rodeo Drive and onto the Santa Monica Pier. Excellent afternoon. Circq du Soleil is on the Santa Monica beach - did not attend. Watched the surfers, fishermen (crabs & Lobsters) and the buskers performerances. We drove back, parked at the hotel and walked Hollywood Blvd. and checked the stars. Sleazy and just like Niagara Falls Ont type entertainment. The second day he gave us printed google maps to go to Universal Studios - what a blast... a must see in LA. The King Kong 3D show was amazing. Spend some time at Universal's Citywalk and mall and at night we visited the Grauman Theatre. Impressive but not exciting. The next day we spent on a drive through Griffith Park and checked out the Observatory. Need at least 1/2 a day on this activity. We were closest to the Hollywood sign and it is very visible. The view from the Observatory is incredible. Spent the night roaming the streets of LA and souvenir shopping. The only negative about Rodeway Inn. It says continental breakfast.... 2 cereals, milk, juice, a cellowrapped muffins and donuts :( And too soon and our trip ended....

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ants in the room”
Reviews.Author: MikeR1989
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location of this motel is great! Located on Sunset Blvd., it's just a short walk to the famous Hollywood Blvd. (Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre,...). It's also a great starting point if you plan to visit Universal Studios Hollywood (just a 10 minute drive). The room has been renovated shortly before. It seemed to be clean at first, but later we recognized that there were ants in our room. Unfortunately we also had them in our suitcases afterwards. The nights were a little bit creepy, as you hear police cars all night long. I would avoid to leave the room after sunset. We stayed 4 nights there. Apart from the "Ants problem", the room was nice and worth the money, considering the big plus of this motel --> the great location!

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Mrpatrick1989
Reviews.Content: Location was pretty good, need to walk some, rooms were out dated and painted really poorly, the lock on the doors aren't too secure, there is no breakfast.. Says there is but all I have to say is we had to go to chick fil a across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Lodging In Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: panoramarick
Reviews.Content: I was in Hollywood last weekend to shoot some video interviews and to cover an event at the Roosevelt Hollywood Hotel. The Rodeway Inn was just a few blocks away and about 1/3 the price of the Roosevelt, so I chose it based on other positive reviews on Trip Advisor. I have good and bad things to report about the Rodeway Inn. Let’s get the bad out of the way first: my biggest negative is that this place is incredibly noisy! In all fairness, there is nothing they can do about it. It is located right on Sunset Boulevard, which is always busy. At night I became more aware of the constant noise caused by the steady scream of firetruck, ambulance and police sirens. How can there be so many emergencies going on all night long? Top that off with constant helicopters doing something overhead, idiots on motorcycles giving it full throttle to get to the next stop light, big throaty trucks that vibrated my room, cars with stereos so loud I could hear them in my room… well, you get the picture. Don’t expect a nice quiet place to sleep. The shape of the motel may serve to capture and reverberate the road noise. Continuing on the topic of noise, the walls in this Rodeway Inn are very thin. About 12:30 AM the second night I heard the phone ringing in the room next to me just as I was drifting off to sleep. The guy finally woke up and proceeded to have a long, loud conversation and I could hear every word he said. About an hour and a half later some drunk person was banging on a door nearby, demanding to be let in. Ear plugs are a good idea if you stay here. I really appreciated mine. After a restless night you can expect either donuts, croissants or other sweet pastries as a main dish, little boxes of mostly sweet cereals, and milk, juice, coffee and fresh fruit for breakfast. On my last day the bananas looked like they had been up all night, too. They set it out once and once it is gone it is gone. It is served in the tiny registration office so you’ll want to take it back to your room. The walls looked fairly recently painted and there was crown moulding on the ceiling, but the furniture needed replacing. One of my chairs had a big rip in seat. Now, on to the positives: it is an inexpensive place to stay in Hollywood. There are lots of restaurants and shopping nearby and you are just a couple of blocks away from Hollywood Boulevard where there is always something going on. It does have location going for it. Be sure to check out Off Broadway Shoe Warehouse just down the block. They must have the world’s largest collection of shoes at discount prices. I bought three pair. After I checked in I asked to be moved from a tiny king bed room to a double queen room because I needed more space to set up a backdrop and light to shoot some interviews. They were accommodating about the move but charged me $10 more per night for the larger room. I have to say the person checking me in was friendly and helpful. My bed was comfortable and the maid did a nice job of tidying up every day. It surprised me that the toiletries included trial packages of Breathe Right Strips (maybe to help keep snoring noise down) and even hair goo for men, as well as a travel size tube of toothpaste. I suggest they also include a set of earplugs. They left ample soap and shampoo, but no lotion or conditioner. Towels and washcloths were standard issue. The bathroom was clean and had a nice size shower/tub. There was plenty of hot water but the water pressure was very low. My towels and bedding looked clean but they seriously need to clean the carpets. Every time I walked barefoot over the carpet and got into the shower I left dirty foot tracks on the wet tub. I spilled a little milk one day and when I tried to blot it up with a washcloth the washcloth turned black. So, if you have toddlers I’d keep them off the carpet as much as possible. There is free, fast wi-fi and it is very easy to connect. There is coffee service, a microwave and a small refrigerator in the room. I had to disconnect my refrigerator at night because it became very noisy. The airconditioner worked well and was quiet. The TV is an older CRT model, not a flat screen, but it worked OK. There is a tiny work desk. There is no closet; only an open area to hang your clothes. There is a small swimming pool, but I didn’t try it. They kept it clean. So there you have it. If you want to visit Hollywood and are on a budget, it is among the least expensive places to stay. They try hard to make it look nice, the maid service is good and the beds are comfortable. You’re within a 5 minute walk of the center of Hollywood Boulevard, have lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. If you just need a place to sleep and can handle the traffic noise, it is a good choice. Just remember to bring earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood, Santa Monica, Universal Studios off the bucket list.”
Reviews.Author: Patricia S
Reviews.Content: We had a very clean comfortable 3 night stay. No bed bugs at all! Our room was 1 king no smoking and it was as it is pictured on their site. We were in the middle of everything HOLLYWOOD. Our rental car was the perfect size for their guest parking, those with SUV's had a lot tighter spot. Continental breakfast was very good quality and the staff was very helpful and friendly. If you are a nit-picker stay elsewhere...if you want to stay with your favorite brother in his nicest room & save some money, I think you'll be very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cheap and Clean.. Fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: jazvrx
Reviews.Content: Staff were very helpful, checkout time is 11am, yet my flight wasnt until 1030pm but they were more than happy to hold my luggage at no cost for most of the day. Rooms are big, bed very comfy only thing was lugging heavy suitcases up the stairs. Very close the Hollywood Boulevard which is why i chose it and most tour companies pick you up from the door step. would stay again no doubt, dont get too excited about the breakfast included, its not a sit down, its more grab and run, which suited me fine but not for everyone. Complimentry toiletries and a nice hand cream added bonus. Eateries around close walking distance, i arrived late around 8pm was getting dark, was solo so i didnt hang around outside too long had a dodgy feel but not enough that i was running looking over my shoulder, just kept my wits about me. Would stay here again, everything was clean, comfy and affordable, and staff more than helpful. Basic tea coffee facilities in room, fridge and microwave, air con.

Reviews.Title: “Have not stayed yet..”
Reviews.Author: GinaBear
Reviews.Content: Does anyone know if they use mattress covers & what the bed bug situation is like? Are there any bugs in the room at all? Are the rooms clean? My son & I are planning a trip next month and just wanted to check b4 we went...Any comments would be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a bad area”
Reviews.Author: heyuwiththeface
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks dodgy on the outside, but the rooms are really nice, and the desk staff is excellent. The man who was working there helped set us up on a tour, and told us which ones to take. They also let us leave our bags behind the front desk while we did some sightseeing and called a car to take us to the airport when we returned. The rooms were clean, and the pool was also really nice, but we didn't get to swim. Be careful outside at night, it's kind of sketchy.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean, modern motel, excellent Hollywood location!”
Reviews.Author: bluefish1
Reviews.Content: I and 2 friends stayed here to visit Hollywood and the surrounding areas whilst on a road trip from San Francisco in a rental car. Parking was available as soon as we drove in. There was about 4 vacant spaces and parking was free of charge (great!). The location is excellent. It is basically 1 block south of Hollywood Boulevard "walk of fame" and the theatres. This was great for us as it was in easy reach and a little quieter to stay at away from all people traffic of Hollywood Boulevard. There are some handy eateries very near by this hotel too. iHop and Mel's Drive-in Diner were great for breakfast and there is a handy In-N-out Burger across the street as well as a Pinkberry frozen yogurt a little further down the street. We arrived late at about 21:30 after a long drive. The check in staff were friendly, polite and prompt. They issued us with the electronic chip-type keys and explained the usual checkout and breakfast times. Our room (214) was on floor 2 with the usual open motel-style hallway. The 2 beds were very conformable, if not a little small for double beds. The room was a nice size for the 3 of us and very clean and tidy. There was great free Wi-Fi and an average CRT TV with some cable channels, but we didn’t use it for much other than news/weather. The whole hotel and site looked like it had recently had a very good renovation, everywhere was spotless and decor was smart and tidy. The bathroom was very clean and smelt fresh. Free toiletries were also provided. The pressure of the shower could've been a little better. The in-room wall-mounted AC unit was a bit noisy and not too effective. There was a fairly small swimming pool in a fenced off area of the courtyard next to the car park. The pool water was clean and there were some patio chairs and shade on the poolside area. Great to chill out in after a long day looking round Hollywood. A complimentary breakfast was laid out in reception each morning 7am-9am. It was very handy to grab & go and included items such as cereals, apples, bananas, orange juice, fresh milk, fresh brewed coffee, cookies, croissants and a donut selection. It was handy to have first thing before heading out although I would advise collecting your breakfast early as it is pretty cleared out by 9am! To summarise it was a great value stay in a clean, comfortable and convenient hotel. If I visited Hollywood again I would definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice central location”
Reviews.Author: DaisyHolland
Reviews.Content: Rooms aren't very big, the pool is tiny, but it's central location was pretty good. Enough to explore in walking distance (Walk of fame e.g.) Plenty of breakfasts to be found (Ihop next door more or less)

Reviews.Title: “close to everywhere, reasonable room, really noisy”
Reviews.Author: magicmum4
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights, first night kept awake by nearby rooms partying until 5am - walking in and out along the balcony past our window, shouting and singing, banging doors. It was awful, although prob not the motel 's fault. Traffic noise is fairly horrendous but we hot used to that. Room was large, clean, good amenities (fridge, microwave and coffee maker) clean large bathroom with hot shower. Housekeeping was spotless every day. Very comfortable bed. Breakfast very basic and just in the small reception area, no tables. Free WiFi was great. And on our last day reception looked after our luggage until 5pm for no charge - great !! Too cold to swim but the small pool looked clean and inviting except that it is quite open to the street so no privacy. Walking distance to Hollywood Boulevard, easyaccess to great public transport right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in America”
Reviews.Author: NewHavenTraveler17
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Los Angeles and are looking to stay within a good distance of the Walk of Fame, Capitol Records and the Kodak/Grauman Theatre; Stay here! The rooms are decorated wonderfully and it makes you feel like a star to stay here. Guy at the desk was very friendly! Deffinately staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate place for a bachelor party”
Reviews.Author: SFDolceVita
Reviews.Content: It's a miracle that my friends and I were not evicted. If you're going to Hollywood to party this is a great spot. If you are looking for a quiet place to sleep look elsewhere. The Seventh Vail and Crazy Girls are each about a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, not too bad”
Reviews.Author: leonie2606
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in September 2010 before heading to Las Vegas. When we checked in, the man on reception was very rude and unhelpful, and offered no help in lugging our suitcases up the stairs to get to our room, which is the last thing you need after a 10 hour flight and being awake for 19 hours, so we were disappointed at first. However, the next day, it was a different man on reception who was very helpful and gave us a list of bars/restaurants to go to and he also had very good local knowledge and warned us of bad areas to avoid. The room was clean and spacious and the air-conditioning worked fine. The only thing I found strange was having the wash basins outside the bathroom in the bedroom part, but it wasn't a problem, just felt a little weird lol. This hotel is in a very good location, about a 5 minute walk to Hollywood Boulevard where you will find the Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre, Mini-supermarkets, Souvenir shops, Hooters and other bars and restaurants. It is however, quite a distance from the main bars on Sunset Strip and you will need a taxi as we found out the first night. We started walking and after 45mins, still could see no bars, so we flagged down a taxi and it still took an extra 10mins by car. (be prepared, taxi's are not easily available). There was a small swimming pool, but it didn't look very well maintained and I wouldn't risk going for a swim, however, we did see a couple of people using it. I would recommend this hotel if you are only in LA for a short while.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Friendly Staff! AMAZING LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: ElGordo727
Reviews.Content: We flew in from BC, Canada and came from LAX to the Rodeway Inn! I was a little spectacle due to other review and seemingly low cost. (FYI we booked direct from their website and used our CAA (AAA) card for $10 off. Location was perfect as we too were going to a taping of Jimmy Kimmel (Slayer!!!) It was across from Hollywood High, just up from In-N-Out Burger and 7min walk to Hollywood Blvd. (El Capitan Theatre) Front staff was friendly and available Room was big and clean King Bed was comfy and huge WiFi was free and good signal Bathroom shower pressure was quite poor No Safe in room Pool was tiny and not clean although the birds loved it! Staff allowed us to park the next day in their lot from am to approx. 3pm without an issue. So if you are looking for a place to sleep, close to strip and all attractions with friendly staff then this will work. Cheap and couldn't be better located!

Reviews.Title: “not a bad spot!”
Reviews.Author: stephen46mo
Reviews.Content: stayed here april 14 1 night, excelent location, went to jimmy kimmel and is just a quick walk,not a bad part of town seemed safe! hollywood blvd just 5 minute walk.guy didnt seem to reindly when checking in, but freindly when leaving.all in all it was good value fror the $$ in that area cheaper then motel 6 just down the road and nicer rooms. ive stayed in both.and plenty of dining close to, also 7 eleven close!ill go back when i go again if $$$ is right! paid about $75 including tax!

Reviews.Title: “untrained, unapologetic staff and bug infested rooms”
Reviews.Author: winky85
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived at this inn i was skeptical. The location is great, although somewhat shady at nightfall. The inn looks like the sort of establishment a secondhand car dealer would bring a prostitute to on his lunch break. The thick pane of glass between guests and staff in the office was unnerving, and indicative of the safety of the area. At first glance, our room appeared clean. The television had poor reception (although this isn't a huge issue) and there were fridge and microwave facilities. The room certainly wasn't anything fancy, but was definitely adequate for the price. I was feeling very pleased with our decision in the morning, when we noticed something crawling across the bed. Upon closer inspection (and comparison with images on the internet) we discovered it was an adult bedbug. I caught the bug, and brought it down to the office in a cup. The guy in the office wasn't apologetic, but was fairly compliant in allowing us to check out early. I was assured I would receive a refund, and was told to go a couple of inns down the road to the comfort inn where they would 'look after' us. The guy behind the desk there was rude, and refused to look after our baggage while we returned the hire car. We have been pedantically careful about bedbugs, and fortunately had kept all our luggage zipped up on the tiled area. Irrespective of this, the next 24 hours (at least) was spent washing all of our clothes, and wiping down and brushing all our baggage. I realise that tourists bring in bedbugs, and this is not the hotel's fault. But the way in which the establishment deals with the infestation indicates whether the establishment is negligent or not. After checking in to another hotel (dont worry..we left our baggage outside, and cleaned all of it thoroughly!!) it took multiple phonecalls to negotiate a refund as the manager was never there. The woman I spoke to was very unapologetic, and told me they had 'inspected the room and found nothing'. I felt as though she was implying that I had fabricated the entire issue, and that they had no intention of treating the room. I dread to think of how many people's luggage could potentially become infested. I have since received a refund, although it is clear i will not be refunded for the night i stayed. Overall, this hotel appears fine at first glance, but the untrained, unapologetic, unhelpful staff made our stay an absolute nightmare. I still have the bites to prove it!

Reviews.Title: “Moneys worth!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 2Aussiegals
Reviews.Content: Staying in this hotel as we speak. We checked out a lot of others for similar or greater prices which were in the same area but were very grungy and dirty. This hotel is nice, very clean and is cleaned every day, microwave, fridge, breakfast in morning, has a pool, wireless internet and big getting ready area with granite benches all for around the same price as a hostel!!! We got discount on tours and the guy behind the desk was very helpful and kind. So overall the staff are very friendly it is a great location being one street behind Hollywood and we would definitively recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “A good Motel..deserves good reveues”
Reviews.Author: UkTravelling_man01
Reviews.Content: A good value and location motel. I was unsure when booking because of some of the revues. When I arrived, the motel looked well kept, and staff could not have been more helpful. The rooms were good standard and clean, and the rate paid for a, two bed, room was reasonable for the location., The area felt safe during the day, and a mile long walk along 'Sunset' to the Palladium theatre, and return at 11pm, in the evening,was comfortable and safe. Short walk to 'Walk of Fame' (10 mins). Breakfast comprised of coffee, tea, cakes, cookies, Croissants, and fruit. I would recomend to families and singles. Ignore the 'whingers'

Reviews.Title: “two nights in sept 09”
Reviews.Author: GLOVELAND
Reviews.Content: i spent two nights at the rodeway inn...when we first got their i was totally turned off...the check in was thru a bullet proff glass and yet the man behind the glass was very pleasant. the first night a couple was having a very very heated argument right outside our door...it went on for over an hour...very scarry not sure what language it was but the anger was on the surface...the second night the sweetest little french children were playing outside...so i am not so sure that sometimes a stay at a hotel is influenced by the other patrons...neg or positive...the hotel was clean but old...stained but conveniently located...room was large enough but old...location location location

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Experience, Best value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: jayboy01
Reviews.Content: Nice room for the money. Good location, walkng distance to all the nightclubs restaurants and Kodak Theatre. This was the second time we stayed there and definitely would stay there again. Manager gave us a good deal on the rates cause we were repeat customers. Highly recommend this place if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the way over-priced price”
Reviews.Author: boo4andrew
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a nasty neighborhood, first of all. The parking was so tight, we had to pull in and reverse about twenty times to even get in or out. We checked in and went to our room, which, once inside, I didn't even want to take my shoes off. THEN we went to the bathroom. There was a GIANT hairball on the floor, there were short and curlies on the hand towels hanging on the rack, the tub was the blackest tub I had ever seen, and there were suspicious stains on the bed sheets!! We only stayed a few hours before checking out, and that was in the middle of the night!!! Later around 10 AM we went back to the hotel to talk to the manager about possibly getting at least some of our money back. The guy, was so indifferent to our complaints, offered up an incredibly weak "sorry" and wouldn't refund any money. It was as though this was a normal complaint there. I had even taken pictures of all the complaints and showed him; he just shrugged his shoulders and said he would talk to housekeeping to do a better job...like that was going to help us out at all!!! But overall, don't stay here - EVER!! Unless you want pure filth in a crappy neighborhood that is semi-close to attractions!! we paid $120 dollars for this crap-hole, which was one of the cheapest in the area!! DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again, Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: OregonCaoster
Reviews.Content: Older and rooms s bit on the small side. But very clean. Staff very friendly and helpful. I am coming back to hollywood in May and will be staying here again. If your looking for a no frills fair priced place to stay this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: PRChinoHills
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I had a concert at the HOB (a few miles away) and even though we read several horrible reviews, decided to stay here anyway since we really only needed a place to crash for a few hours. I had no problem checking into the Inn and the desk attendant was nice enough to give us the option of what room we wanted to stay in. We stayed in room 215. We were pleasantly surprised with the room. It was a good size room with a king bed, mini fridge and microwave. It had a nice little table with 2 chairs. Although the room smelled a little musty, we simply opened up the window for a few minutes which got rid of the smell. The bathroom was adequate and large enough to allow 2 to 3 girls getting ready. The bed was comfortable. I was too tired to hear the outside noise but my girlfriend (light sleeper) said she was able to hear quite a bit of noise from the street. The Inn is right on the street so it's expected. The Inn had a small pool which was a nice touch if you have little ones. You have to remember that the Inn is small to begin with, so it was surprising to see a little pool. It also has a pool side table. The Inn is perfect for sightseeing and simply going back to lay your head. If you're planning on spending your vacation in a hotel, this is not the hotel to do it in. The room was great for the price we paid. We've decided that we will come back to this Inn if we're going out to Hollywood to have a good time. Although the parking lot is a little on the smaller side, there is a parking lot, which is a bonus. The parking was free and we felt safe enough to leave the car there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: oskippyone
Reviews.Content: Honestly, this hotel is worth every penny paid. We purposely wanted a hotel that was budget friendly and in a great location. Everything was within ease walking distance. The showers occasionally had some ants visit, which I could've lived without. They definitely had new sheets and bed spreads, but they were weighed funny and often fell off the bed. The pool was shady, I didn't even consider hopping in. Don't waste your time on the free breakfast, it's maybe a few banana's and nature valley granola bars. GREAT Location with regards to In-n-Out Burger.. Which we ate at three times.. Easily. This is no hilton. You pay for what you get!

Reviews.Title: “Rodeway Inn Revamped !”
Reviews.Author: Travel'inged
Reviews.Content: There's been a lot of bad reviews on tnis Inn, however I took a chance and stayed for a weekend and was pleasantly surprised ! They have just installed new carpet in all the rooms. Each room has comfortable bedding, a/c, crown molding, colored accent walls, local cable t.v., full bathroom w/ separate dressing area, and spacious rooms. There's a 7-11 within walking distance, a juice/shake bar, and a Grocery store just a few blocks away. Not to mention you are right on sunset Blvd. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Crap hole”
Reviews.Author: jcroly
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed at!! BARKING dog next door, rude hotel staff, obnoxious guests next door either making noise really late at night or smoking in front of our room. Do not stay here! The hotel was last remodeled when LA first became a county. The prices are not cheap and the continental breakfast is crappy, crusty donuts with stale coffee. Great if you like $%&^

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!! Stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: jason123445
Reviews.Content: The worst place I have ever been too. The staff was rude and they don't seem to care about the guests. The temperature outside was 50 degrees, the temperature inside was also 50 degrees. As you can probably guess - no heater available. We had to sleep with our jackets on. I find it hard to believe that there is a worse place than that.

Reviews.Title: “Really really dingy but adequate”
Reviews.Author: HollySTL
Reviews.Content: When I first checked in to this hotel, it was the closest I'd ever come to actually giving up my 3 night's payment and going to a different hotel. It is located right on Sunset Blvd which is a very busy street 24 hours/day and the parking lot is cramped (they actually repainted the parking spot lines so that more cars could be cramped in and I was constantly worried that someone would knock the mirror off my car at night although that never happened). This is definitely not frequented by business people (I saw mostly construction workers and young tourists). When I checked in wearing my business suit, carrying my laptop, and asking for a quiet room, the guy at the front desk felt so badly for me that he gave me the keys to both of the available rooms and told me to see which one was quieter and whether "the toilet works." That was nice of him but says a lot about the motel. The rooms smell like sewage, the bath tub and toilet were scratched up, and there was obvious dirt (even a footprint) on my bedsheets. There was a burn mark on the carpet in the shape of an iron and the furniture was filthy. This was when I almost left. But since it was late at night and I had an early interview the next morning, I stayed. The neighborhood is moderately safe (I felt ok as a solo female walking across the street to get a sandwich but I wouldn't go much farther than that) and, amazingly, you don't hear much street noise once you close the door and turn on the fan. I also went out and bought an air freshner to disguise the sewage smell. The free WiFi is pretty fast and I actually slept well all 3 nights there (despite sleeping fully dressed because I didn't trust the dirty sheets). Continental breakfast consists of doughnuts and coffee ONLY. Overall, I feel like I was lucky to have slept well at that place but I certainly would not stay there again. There's a Days Inn right across the street that looks a lot more acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyTheWanderer
Reviews.Content: Wow, this place is great for what it is. A budget motel in Hollywood. with free parking and free Wi-Fi. These people who complain expect to get a place like the Hilton or Hyatt for $100 in Hollywood. They just need to cough up the $200+ it takes to get a nice place and quit bagging on the Rodeway. It's a roadside motel with 4 walls and a bed.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 is probably better”
Reviews.Author: TeufelWolf
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel, I wanted something extra over and above a bed. But after staying there for five nights, it would have been better to have saved $10 a night and booked a room at Motel 6. The hotel's web site says that the hotel provides "Free Deluxe Continental Breakfast". A donut is NOT a "Deluxe Continental Breakfast". I called the chain HQ, and they could not explain what is Deluxe about it. The website says All Rooms: In-Room Coffee Maker. We stayed in two different rooms, neither had a coffee maker. You want ice? That will be $0,50. You want a extra room key, that will be $5.00. You want to make a local call, that will be a $10.00 deposit. Cost for these services at Motel 6... $0.00 Some positives. Hotel location. South of Hollywood Blvd, and West of Highland means A LOT less traffic getting to or from hotel. Generally safe neighborhood (for Hollywood). Over a long stay, the microwave and fridge can say you a lot in food if you bring your own food.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: JRinSD
Reviews.Content: Not bad for a budget motel. My friend and I stayed here on a Saturday night because we wanted to be centrally located. The property is in the heart of Hollywood and close to everything. The neighborhood is noisy and a bit seedy but not dangerous. We walked everywhere and felt perfectly safe. The room was clean but no frills - there was a small refrigerator and a microwave. Basic cable. One of the bedside lamps had a burnt out bulb. The towels and linens were clean. The decor standard budget motel. The front desk employee was friendly and professional. There was plenty of parking. Most of the other guests appeared to be tourists, some with children. The pool was a bit scary - small and the water looked cloudy, Overall, it was worth the $90 we paid. Don't expect deluxe amenities, but if you are looking for a convenient, clean room for a night or two in Hollywood, you could do alot worse,

Reviews.Title: “Wow, I must not be too picky...”
Reviews.Author: jmsal
Reviews.Content: I guess I must not be too hard to please, because I was not unhappy with the room. My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights and loved it. We looked at the room for what it was...somewhere to sleep at night. The rooms were decent, not dirty at all. The bathroom curtain could have been changed, but it was very well located (only two blocks from Grauman's Chinese Theatre), and a 15 minute drive from Universal Studios and Sunset Strip. IHOP is less than a 5 minute walk and a great smoothie place. I saw no problems with leaving our rental convertable mustang in the free parking lot, or walking around the area. I'm not the most picky traveler, but I'm experienced (lived in Europe, studied abroad in SE Asia). Granted this place isn't the Hyatt, but for $85/night, I couldn't beat the area or the room.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely gross!!! stay away!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amakristy
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be shut down! There were feses spots on and in the rim of the toilet. I didn't dare sit (used tissue to cover seat). Walls and doors were filthy. Splashes on the walls weren't even cleaned off. The comforters had large burn holes and 1-2 ft. tears in each. At least the sheets were clean looking. Not the same for the blanket. The pillows were waaaaay lumpy. Good thing I had one in car. The towels were like sandpaper. I was only in town for one night and saw the hotel sign say "new rooms". YEAH RIGHT!!! Decided to stay since we were only sleeping. The rude receptionist/clerk probably wouldn't have given us a refund anyway. Next time I am taking disinfecting wipes, more pillows and my own towels to any hotel I go to. I sure hope enough people and the franchise see this and investigate...

Reviews.Title: “good area, comfort rooms”
Reviews.Author: rinl
Reviews.Content: i liked the rooms, beds were cosy, and clean bathroom, the staff at desk was helpful

Reviews.Title: “pathetic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: it's the worst hotel, sorry motel, in the whole hollywood. 50% of their dirty rooms are filled with prostitutes and transexuals. Their desk clerks are bunch of bangladesis who barely speak english. Had the worst experience of my life staying there. HIGHLY NOT RECOMMENDED !!!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Budget Inn is located in a seedy area across from the fenced in Hollywood High School. However, it is convenient to the Chinese theatre, Kodak Center, Jimmy Kimmel show etc. and reasonably priced. Room was clean though had an odd odor that I couldn't identify. Staff was excellent with directions and advice--patient, too.

Reviews.Title: “Whorehouse/Motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you love getting harrassed by prostitutes and their pimps at all hours of the night, you will love the Budget Inn. The curteous yet dirty staff was more than helpful in making sure that our stay was as miserable as possible. The random phone calls at six in the morning were a nice touch. However, it is close to In and Out.

HotelInfo.Name: Rodeway Inn Hollywood
HotelInfo.Address: 6826 Sunset Blvd., Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
